items.raw_desc: Tea Basilur Carnival Christmas Fantasy 75 g:Have you fallen in love with drinking tea and enjoy it in the peace and quiet of your home? Then you will definitely be interested in Basilur tea. Black tea has been known to mankind since the 16th century. It all starts with the harvesting of the leaves of the Chinese or Assamese tea tree. The next step is the so-called. wilting, which is the process by which water evaporates from the petals. Subsequently, they are scrolled. The final step is the oxidation process. The final taste, aroma and colour of the tea depend most on this part of the processing. Oxidation is stopped by rapid heating, e.g. pan-frying, steaming or baking. You can buy Basilur tea in a 75 g pack. items.raw_desc: Pulzoximéter Contec CMS50D:        The Contec CMS50D oximeter is suitable for use at home, on the road and in medical facilities. It is intended for non-invasive measurement of hemoglobin oxygen saturation, in the arethral part of the bloodstream, and heart rate. It is a suitable tool for asthmatics, people with heart disease, but also athletes and those who move at great heights. To measure, it uses two light rays with different wavelengths, which fall on a finger inserted into the device. It measures the saturation of the blood with oxygen in the range of 0-100% and the heart rate in the range of 30-235 beats per minute. Black tea was first mentioned in China at the end of the 16th century. The beginning of production is at the harvest of Chinese or Assam tea leaves. The next step is the so-called. wilting, which is the process by which water evaporates from the petals. The petals are then rolled. The oxidation process, which is part of the final treatment, gives the tea its final flavour, aroma and colour. Oxidation is stopped by rapid heating, e.g. pan-frying, steaming or baking. Basilur tea can be purchased in packs weighing a total of 100 g.
